Affirmative:

Redemptive Violence 1AC

Welcome to the age of excess. Modern capitalism relies upon the elevation of
excess to the structuring principle of social life -- the consumption of
fossil fuels is a particularly emblematic example. While some believe that the
impending ecological catastrophe will force a consciousness shift that will
awaken anti-capitalist resistance against excessive consumption, this stance
fatally underestimates capital's potential to turn seeming catastrophes
engendered by its own development into incentives for its propagation. The
crisis of capitalism caused by the gap between use-value and exchange-value,
which expands irrespective of the actual needs of real people, is nearing a
point at which its eruption is assured.
Slavoj Zizek, Professor of Sociology at the Institute for Sociology, Ljubljana
University, 2002, Revolution at the Gates, p. 277-78
"In what precise sense, then...explode at any moment."

The current political situation and its attitudes toward energy consumption
belie the nature of modern capitalism -- the Bush administration's insistence
that reducing consumption would disadvantage the poor is a convenient method
of keeping the social totality plugged into the capitalist order.
Unfortunately, traditional opposition to the given order is misguided -
- it relies on what Lacan identified as the masculine formula of sexuation,
which amounts to an attempt to transgress the system's rules which the system
is built to account for. In contrast, we should model our resistance to
capitalism on Lacan's feminine formula of sexuation, which recognizes that
there is no position regarding the system which is external and neutral, and
simultaneously that the system will never be able to fully totalize itself.
This strategy acts as a singularity in the face of the system which highlights
the falsity of the system's claims to universality.
Slavoj Zizek, Professor of Sociology at the Institute for Sociology, Ljubljana
University, 2002, Revolution at the Gates, p. 266-68
"I am tempted to go even further here...a kind of anamporphic distortion."

Our impact is the creation of the capitalist subject - contemporary capitalism
causes a form of subjectivity to emerge in which individuals are fundamentally
atomized from one another, perceiving every contact with others as a threat
that requires violent reaction.
Slavoj Zizek, Professor of Sociology at the Institute for Sociology, Ljubljana
University, 1993, Tarrying With The Negative, p. 218-19
"And it seems as if today we live in an age...can we effectively call this
Spinozism into question?"

Thus, we ask you to resolve yourself that the United States Federal Government
should establish an energy policy requiring a substantial reduction in the
total non-governmental consumption of fossil fuels in the United States.

Our strategy for resisting capitalism is one of redemptive violence -- by
renouncing the consumption of fossil fuels, we break our link to the
capitalist order. The path to true revolutionary subjectivity cannot proceed
directly from the cold abstraction of capitalist subjectivity. The first step
toward liberation is to strike at our own libidinal investment in a given
situation -- in our case, such a strategy is actualized by our renunciation of
energy consumption. Just like Tyler Durden in Fight Club, our metaphorical act
of self-beating makes the master-servant relationship fostered by capitalism
irrelevant. Once the symbolic and actual chains linking us to the capitalist
order begin to be broken by redemptive violence, the real enemy can be met
head-on: the system itself.
Slavoj Zizek, Professor of Sociology at the Institute for Sociology, Ljubljana
University, 2002, Revolution at the Gates, p. 250-53
"The thing to do, therefore...you set yourself free."

Finally, redemptive violence is not a celebration of actual, physical
violence. Rather, our argument is that liberation is a painful process,
involving a direct lashing out against the perverse enjoyment offered by the
capitalist order in the form of energy consumption. Such a position is the
only way our relationships to such an order can be truly altered.
Slavoj Zizek, Professor of Sociology at the Institute for Sociology, Ljubljana
University, September 29, 2003, online: ttp://www.electronicbookreview.com/v3/s
ervlet/ebr?command=view_essay&essay_id=rasmussen, accessed August 1, 2004
"Now I come to truly answering...sorry, it hurts."

Thermal Depolymerization 1AC:

Contention One -- Thanks For A Good Aff Idea, Texas

Science fiction has become a reality in Carthage, Missouri -- there, a plant
using the thermal depolymerization process churns tons of turkeys into oil
every day. Next on the list of animals to be turned into oil are cows
with "mad cow disease", which are viewed as irrelevant to humanity and
suitable for sacrifice.
Omaha World Herald, May 20, 2004

And, thermal depolymerization will explode in the near future -- by 2006,
1,000 tons of animals per day will be converted into oil
New York Times, December 7, 2003

The slaughter of "diseased" cows casts these creatures as a perfect example of
life caught within the violence of modern biopolitics. This form of violence
occurs in a space of exception where the sovereign is granted the power to
darken the skies with the ashes of the dead under full sanction of the law.
Dinesh Wadiwel, doctoral student at the University of West Sydney, 2002,
Borderlands, Volume 2 No. 1, online:
http://www.borderlandsejournal.adelaide.edu.au/vol1no2_2002/wadiwel_cows.html,
accessed December 30, 2004

These spaces of exception manifest as places where literally any violence is
possible. Non-human animals are targeted for massive biopolitical violence
because of a perceived gap between humans and non-humans made possible solely
by the state of exception. This way of treating life seeps into all aspects of
our existence, and will determine the very fate of humanity.
Dinesh Wadiwel, doctoral student at the University of West Sydney, 2002,
orderlands, Volume 2 No. 1, online:
http://www.borderlandsejournal.adelaide.edu.au/vol1no2_2002/wadiwel_cows.html,
accessed December 30, 2004

Thus, the United States Federal Government should establish an energy policy
requiring a substantial reduction in the total non-governmental consumption of
fossil fuels in the United States by prohibiting the consumption of fossil
fuels produced from human and non-human animals by the thermal
depolymerization process.

Contention Two: Rage Against the Machine

Politics as usual has exempted non-human animals from consideration of their
interests and agency as political beings. In contrast, we should conceive of a
politics that closes our eyes to the supposed gap between human and non-human
animals, allowing for an ethical reorientation of politics.
Dinesh Wadiwel, doctoral student at the University of West Sydney, 2002,
Borderlands, Volume 2 No. 1,
online:
http://www.borderlandsejournal.adelaide.edu.au/vol1no2_2002/wadiwel_cows.html,
accessed December 30, 2004

Any conception of ethics apart from biopolitics necessitates a rethinking of
our current ways of relating to non-human animals. The operation of
sovereignty that places non-human animals in spaces of exception must be
stopped. An affirmative ballot signals a new form of ethics that makes the
violence of modern biopolitics impossible.
Nathan Snaza, Curriculum and Instruction Dept at the University of Minnesota,
2004, Animal Liberation Philosophy and Policy Journal, Vol 2 No 1, online:
http://www/cala-online.org/Journal/Issue2/Impossible%20Witness.htm, accessed
January 19, 2005

Bartleby 1AC:

In one debate this year we read the story "Bartleby the Scrivener" and
said "we affirm the topic in its potentiality" in the 1AC.

Let me know if you need any further disclosure info, and thanks for running
the NDT caselist.
Jeff
Whitman

Whitman Beth Schueller/Eric Suni

 

Whitman SS – 1AC outline – post NU

Observation One is the status quo:

Lack of standards has tilted the market toward less fuel efficient vehicles

Southern California and Orange County Real Estate, 2004, http://www.iconocast.com/Economy4_Business22_04/News9.htm

New vehicles in the United States, meanwhile

 

Bush’s emphasis on voluntary programs to reduce transportation consumption is causing states to step in, resulting in patchwork implementation and Transatlantic tension

IPS-Inter Press Service, September 9/30, 2004

Bush himself denounced the treaty, which requires industrialized

 

Federal regulation is key to avert a state by state patchwork that hurts automakers

David Welch, Business Week, 2002

Detroit was blindsided. Expecting an assault of environmental legislation

 

The coming patchwork will be a logistical nightmare for automakers who’re calling for uniform standards

Chicago Tribune, 7/4/2004

California's plan to sharply cut automotive emissions of global

 

California’s regulations will open the doors for other states to act. Detroit would like tougher federal regulations.

Business Week, May 20, 2002

Detroit was blindsided. Expecting an assault of environmental legislation

 

The Plan: The United States Federal Government should establish an energy policy requiring a substantial reduction in the total non-governmental consumption of fossil fuels in the United States by substantially increasing the Corporate Average Fuel Economy standard for cars and light trucks in the United States.

 

Advantage one is an end to oil:

The world is running out of fossil fuel. Current estimates of oil supply are based on status quo consumption rates instead of future consumption. Depletion of oil is accelerating.

David Goodstein, Physicist and Vice Provost at California Institute of Technology, 2004, Out of Gas, pg. 45-6

As we saw earlier, many experts think there is enough oil in the ground

 

And, an end to oil is coming, oil shocks, global economic depression, and war are all inevitable without  reduced consumption

Paul Roberts, energy expert and writer for Harpers,2004, The End of Oil, pg.12-13

Suppose, for example, that worldwide oil production hits a kind of peak and that

 

Slack in oil markets prevent effective price signals allowing oil to peak before we can respond

Paul Roberts, energy expert and writer for Harpers,2004, The End of Oil, pg. 60

There are, of course, a few flaws in this reassuring argument. First

 

New oil would be unreliable and costly

Paul Roberts, energy expert and writer for Harpers,2004, The End of Oil, pg.47

In truth, however, as some energy companies and government agen­cies

 

Inaction causes hard landing

Paul Roberts, energy expert and writer for Harpers,2004, The End of Oil, pg. 331

Conversely, the costs of inaction are significant. Each year that we fail to commit to

 

Advantage Two is Environmental leadership:

 

Lack of leadership on environmental issues is crippling American hegemony. Increased fuel efficiency standards send a crucial message that reaffirms US legitimacy

Norbert Walter; Norbert Walter is chief economist at Deutsche Bank Group. “An American Abdication,” August 28, 2002

At present there is much talk about the unparalleled strength

 

The coming into force of Kyoto threatens a growing rivalry between the US and Europe. Only by taking strong domestic action can the US respond to restore its leadership

NUKE POWER AFF

Plan: The United States Federal GOvernment should require a transition to
nuclear power by mandating the replacement of all non-governmental sulfur
producing fossil fuel power plants with nuclear power plants.

Contention One: The impending Oil Disaster

First, Global oil will peak in 5 years, radical change is the only option to
stop the near inevitable...
Bently 2002
[Dr. J.W. Expert on oil, and its decline, "Global Oil and Gas Depletion: an
overview," www.greatchange.org/ov-bentley.global_depletion.pdf.
///delo-uwyo]
"the world's production of conventional hydrocarbons will soon
decline...years.  2002 published by elsevier science ltd.

4) loss of confidence in production

issues, finalist for national magazine award 99   THE END OF OIL pg 47 pgf

great depression look like child's play

peak...violent contest for whatever oil supplies remained."

destruction of civilization and the biosphere

COAL EFFICIENCY AFF

CONTENTION ONE: STATUS QUO

BUSH'S CHANGE OF THE NSR SEVERELY RESTRICTS THE EPA'S ENFORCEMENT
POWER, ALLOWING FOR THE GRANDFATHERING OF POWER PLANTS TO EXTEND
FOREVER

LEAHY 2004
[Patrick, Senator of Vermont, "Reacion of Sen. Patrick Leahy, To EPA
Inspector General's Rebuke Of Administration's Loophole For Coal-Fired
Powerplants," http://leahy.senate.gov/press/200409/093004D.html, Sept
30, 2004//delo-uwyo]

"The Inspector General for the U.S. ... is Leahy's reaction to the report."

1AC

PLAN:

The United States Federal Government, specifically the United States
Congress, should require that all non-governmental coal power plants
in the United States increase their combustion heat rate efficiency to
no less than 45% by 2015.  Non-governmental coal power plants built in
the United States after 2015 will be required to achieve a combustion
heat rate efficiency of no less than 50%.

Funding and enforcement are guaranteed.

1AC

ADVANTAGE ONE: POLLUTION

SUBPOINT A: MERCURY

FIRST, EXEMPT COAL PLANTS ARE THE SINGLE LARGEST EMITTERS OF MERCURY

(Rebecca, and Cameron, U.S. Public Interest Research Group (U.S. PIRG)
Education Fund for Clear the Air, the National Campaign Against Dirty
Power, "Lethal Legacy: The Dirty Truth About The Nation's Most
Polluting Power Plants," April 2000, pg. Online @
http://uspirg.org/reports/lethallegacy2000/LethalLegacy.PDF //wyo-ef)

"The 594 dirtiest plants ... operating on or before 1977 (See Chart 11)."

THEY BIOACCUMULATE IN FISH AND POISON HUMANS WHO EAT THE FISH

(Rebecca, and Cameron, U.S. Public Interest Research Group (U.S. PIRG)
Education Fund for Clear the Air, the National Campaign Against Dirty
Power, "Lethal Legacy: The Dirty Truth About The Nation's Most
Polluting Power Plants," April 2000, pg. Online @
http://uspirg.org/reports/lethallegacy2000/LethalLegacy.PDF //wyo-ef)

ADVANTAGE TWO: CHINA

SUBPOINT A: ENERGY CRISIS

CLAYTON 12/23/2004
[Mark, "New coal plants bury 'Kyoto'," The Christian Science Monitor,
Dec. 23//uwyo-crowe]

"The official treaty to curb ...desire to be clean."

AND, CHINA'S COAL FAMINE IS DUE TO POOR COAL EFFICIENCY, INCREASING
POWER SHORTAGES…

BBC 12/26/2004
[BBC Monitorining Asia Pacific, "Power plants in China's Hunan Hit by
'Coal Famine'," Dec. 26//uwyo-crowe]

"Li Weijian, general manager... and poor coal quality."

AND, COAL POLLUTION WILL CRIPPLE CHINA'S ECONOMY

PETROLEUM ECONOMIST 2004
[Petroleum Economist December 3, 2004 //delo-uwyo]

"Alongside energy-supply... global if it ignores China."

AND, THIS COLLAPSES THE WORLD ECONOMY

BEAMS 2004
[Nick, "China 'overheating' spells trouble for world economy," may 5, 2004]

"The growing reliance of... severe global consequences."

AND, THIS CAUSES GLOBAL NUCLEAR WAR AND DESTRUCTION OF THE BIOSPHERE…

BEARDEN (Dir. Association of Distinguished Scientists) 2000
[LTC, T.E.  Fellow Emeritus, AIAS, "The Unnecessary Energy Crisis,
June 24//delo-uwyo]

"Bluntly, we foresee these .. least for many decades."

SUBPOINT B: WORKER SAFETY

FIRST, CHINA'S COAL INDUSTRY HAS AN ATROCIOUS SAFETY RECORD…HUNDREDS
DIE IN MINE ACCIDENTS EVERY MONTH…

DICKIE 12/21/2004
[Mure, "Chinese miners learn to live with danger: Despite reforms, the
fatality rate per tonne of coal is nearly 100 times that of the US,"
Financial Times (London), Dec. 21//uwyo-crowe]

"It was business as usualin ... dangerously for a while."

AND, HOLDING THE CHINESE ECONOMY OVER THE PLIGHT OF WORKERS IS
FUNDAMENTALLY IMMORAL.

NORTH 2001
[James, "NEW CHINA HAND" Nation, 02/19/2001, Vol. 272, Issue 7
accessed online 11.18.04//wyo-bjf]

"Market fundamentalists disregard... dying in total silence."

SUBPOINT C: RAPID EXPANSION

FIRST, CHINA'S COAL DEMAND IS MAKING IT A STRATEGIC RIVAL WITH THE
U.S. NOW WHILE MASSIVE CHINESE MODERNIZATION PLANS CONTINUE…

McGREGOR 12/22/2004
[Richard, "The world should be braced for China's expansion,"
Financial Times (London), Dec. 22//uwyo-crowe]

"US pressure on Japan ... military modernisation plan."

AND, U.S./CHINA ENERGY COOP STOPS ENERGY CONFLICTS, KEY TO RELATIONS

            SNYDER (Korea Representative, Asia Foundation) 2/22/01
            [Scott, "Warnings on East Asia," Energy, v. 2 n. 26, LN//mac-dch]

"China is the primary... waste on the high seas."

AND, THIS GUARANTEES WAR WITH THE UNITED STATES…

MEARSHEIMER 9/20/2004
[John, U. Chicago, "Day One of a Carnegie Endowment for International
Peace Conference," "China's Peaceful Rise?" Federal News Service, Sep.
20//uwyo-crowe]

"MR. MEARSHEIMER: The question at hand is... eventually dominate the system."

AND, THIS RESULTS IN NUCLEAR WAR…

CHICAGO TRIBUNE '96
["China Prepares New Show of Strength," Uli Schmetzer, Feb. 6//uwyo-crowe]

"While a peaceful solution ... a global nuclear holocaust."

CONTENTION TWO: SOLVENCY

THE PLAN SOLVES – THE TIME TABLE SHOULD BE TEN YEARS…

    LEAHY 2001
[Patrick, "Clean Power Plant and Modernization Act of 2001", June 28,
2001//delo-uwyo]

"Fossil fuel-fired power plants ... for even larger reductions."

AND, INCREASING EFFICIENCY STANDARDS FOR ALL COAL PLANTS EFFECTIVELY
CLOSES THE LOOPHOLES IN CURRENT REGULATIONS AND DECREASES THE
CONSUMPTION OF COAL

LEAHY 2001
[Patrick, "Clean Power Plant and Modernization Act of 2001", June 28,
2001//delo-uwyo]

"Mr. President, the Administration...protecting our national resources."

DELIBERATIVE DEMOCRACY AFF

OBSERVATION ONE: THE NONTRANSPARENT CONSTRUCTION OF SOCIAL KNOWLEDGE
ABOUT ENERGY POLICY…

STATUS QUO CONSTRUCTION OF ENERGY POLICY IS DONE BY STEALTH,
DESTROYING PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING…

DAVIDSON 2003
[Osha Gray, "The Ungreening of America, Dirty Secrets;" Mother Jones,
sep/oct, vol. 28, issue 5//uwyo]

"No president has gone after the nation's...the most serious
"environmental" damage of all."

Thus we offer the following rhetorical argument:

The United States Federal Government should establish an energy policy
requiring a substantial reduction in the total non-governmental
consumption of fossil fuels in the United States.

OBERSVATION TWO: COLONIZATION OF THE LIFEWORLD…

SUBPOINT A: INSTITUTIONAL COLONIZATION…

FIRST, ADVANCED INSTITUTIONAL STEERING SYSTEMS CODIFY TECHNICAL
POLICIES FOR THOSE WHO INHABIT THE LIFEWORLD, USING MANAGEMENT
IMPERATIVES TO BLUNT CRITICAL DEBATE…

DOXTADER '95
[Erik, Argumentation and Advocacy, Spring, V. 31, N. 4, p. 185(19),
"Learning Public Deliberation Through the Critique of Institutional
Argument,"//uwyo]

"Basic Habermas' colonization...Habermas' argument is worth noting."

AND, THE EXCLUSION OF VOICES COLLAPSES THE PUBLIC SPHERE…

BRULLE 2000
[Robert J., assoc. prof. Soc & env'tl policy, Drexel U., "Agency,
Democracy, and Nature," p. 36-37//uwyo]

 "The actions of the state are ...right to withhold acclamation"
(Habermas 1973:36)."

AND, FAILURE TO REVERSE SUCH COLONIZATION RISKS OUR TOTAL DESTRUCTION…

Habermas '84
[Jurgen, renowned cultural theorist, The Theory of Communicative
Action, p. 397; translator: Thomas McCarthy//uwyo-crowe]

"If we assume that the...rationalization of the lifeworld run idle."

SUBPOINT B:  THE UNSUSTAINABLE ECOLOGICAL DISCOURSE

FIRST, FAILURE OF CONSENSUS-DRIVEN ECOLOGICAL DISCOURSES IN THE STATUS
QUO DECAYS THE LIFEWORLD ALL THE WAY DOWN THROUGH LANGUAGE AND
CONSCIOUSNESS, DESTROYING PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING…

BRULLE 2000
[Robert J., assoc. prof. Soc & env'tl policy, Drexel U., "Agency,
Democracy, and Nature," p. //uwyo-crowe]

The analysis of discursive frames...preserve the current social order
(Brown 1998).

ADDITIONALLY, THE ABSENCE OF AN ECOLOGICALLY SUSTAINABLE SOCIETY RISKS
THE SUFFERING AND MISERY OR ALL LIVING BEINGS ON EARTH…

BRULLE 2000
[Robert J., assoc. prof. Soc & env'tl policy, Drexel U., "Agency,
Democracy, and Nature," p. 6-7//uwyo-crowe]

 Attempts to deal with global ecological...levels of ecological
disruption occur (Dobkowski and Wallimann 1998).

OBSERVATION THREE: CRITICAL PUBLICITY…

THE ACT OF CRITICIZING INSTITUTIONAL JUSTIFICATIONS REINVIGORATES
PUBLIC DELIBERATION AND PARTICIPATION…

DOXTADER '95
[Erik, Argumentation and Advocacy, Spring, v.31, n.4, p.15, "Learning
Public Deliberation Through the Critique of Institutional
Argument,"//uwyo-delo]

"The colonization of public deliberation occurs...public argument with
political intent."

ADDITIONALLY,

PERFORMATIVE PUBLIC PARTICIPATION AGAINST INSTITUTIONAL CONTROL OF
ENERGY POLICY IS VALUABLE IN AND OF ITSELF…  THE ACT OF OPENING UP
SPACE FOR CRITICAL DELIBERATION GIVES DIVERSE INSIGHTS INTO THE REALM
OF POLITICAL ACTION…

KULYNYCH '97
[Jessica J., Assistant Professor of Political Science at Winthrop
University, "Performing Politics: Foucault, Habermas, and Postmodern
Participation," Polity, Winter, v30 n2, p315(32)//uwyo-crowe]

 "A performative perspective on participation...diverse and
participatory democracy."

LASTLY, THE CREATION OF A 'GREEN' POLITICAL SPHERE VIA PUBLIC
DELIBERATION ESTABLISHES A SUSTAINABLE DEMOCRATIC SOCIETY…

BRULLE 2000
[Robert J., assoc. prof. Soc & env'tl policy, Drexel U., "Agency,
Democracy, and Nature," p. //uwyo-crowe]

"The serious divisions that exist ...actions and then acting together
(ibid.: 107)."

WyomingJS

On the aff- here is what we have run all year

FIRST, LIMITLESS GROWTH IS IMPOSSIBLE- ENERGY, LAND AND FOOD RESOURCES
ARE TOO FINITE AND CANNOT BE MULTIPLIED ANY FURTHER

TRAINER (U. of South Wales, Dedev OG) 2002
[Ted, On the Edge of Scarcity, "Our Unsustainable Society", ed. M.
Dobkowski & I. Wallimann, Syracuse U. Press, p.48-50
The most alarming... ...on the planet.

IAC

GROWTH IS UNSUSTAINABLE, HIDDEN THRESHOLDS EXIST THAT WHEN CROSSED
LEAD TO EXTINCTION

EKINS 1994
(Paul, Department of Economics, Birkbeck College, The University of
London, "Towards sustainable development: Concepts, Methods and
Policy" http://www.dieoff.com/page10.htm accessed 9-2-04 UW//WEJ)
"In the 20 years... survival of life on earth' (WCED 1987, 32-3).

ENERGY CRASH IS INEVITABLE, THE LONGER WE WAIT THE MORE PEOPLE THAT WILL DIE

HANSON 2000
[Jay, founder of deioff.org, "A Means of Control",
http://www.dieoff.org/page185.htm, Revised 15 February 2000, accessed
9-6-04, jds]
Global oil production ...billions of unsuspecting people.

IAC
ADVANTAGE ONE EcoCOLLAPSE:

FIRST, CONTINUING GROWTH WILL ONLY ESCALATE OUR WAR AGAINST THE
ENVIRONMENT, COLLAPSING THE BIOSPHERE

LEWIS (Instructor, Sewall Academic Program @ CU Boulder) 2002
[Chris H., On the Edge of Scarcity, "Global Industrial Civilization:
The Necessary Collapse", ed. M. Dobkowski & I. Wallimann, Syracuse U.
Press, p. 20
With the growth ...destroy global industrial civilization.

IAC

SECOND, WITHOUT CHANGE NOW THERE WILL BE A TOTAL ECO COLLAPSE WITHIN 50 YEARS

MILBRATH (Dir Emeritus of SUNY Buffalo Environment and Society Prog) 2003
[Lester W., "Envisioning a Sustainable Society", Explorations in
Environmental Political Theory, ed. Kassiola, M.E. Sharpe
If we persist ... us victims of change.[p. 40-41

IMMEDIATE MOVE AWAY FROM FOSSIL FUELS IS THE ONLY WAY TO AVOID
DEVASTATING COLLAPSE

PRICE  1995
[David, anthropologist, linguist and research associate with Cornell's
Population & Development Program, "Energy and Human Evolution",
http://www.dieoff.org/page137.htm, March 1995, accessed 9-2-04, jds]
Even if world population ... long survive their loss.

IAC
ADVANTAGE TWO CONFLICT:

BRUTAL ETHNIC WARS THAT THREATEN HUMYN SURVIVAL ARE INEVITABLE BECAUSE
OF GROWTH- MUST ACT ON SUSTAINABLE LIFESTYLE NOW**

MORALES (Prof Comparative International Studies @ U. Central Fla) 2002
[Waltrad Queiser, On the Edge of Scarcity, "Sustainable Development
and Human Security", ed. M. Dobkowski & I. Wallimann, Syracuse U.
Press, p.131-132
More global conflicts ... think and act today.

IAC

SCARCITY CONFLICTS WILL BE IMPOSSIBLE TO MITIGATE- BECOME MORE INTENSE
AND NUMEROUS BECAUSE OF SYSTEM WIDE CONTRACTIONS

DOBKOWSKI & WALLIMANN 2002 (Prof Relig. Studies @ Hobart & William
Smith, Prof Sociology, Economics & Social Policy @ U. of Applied
Sciences, Finland)
[Michael & Isidore, ed, On The Edge of Scarcity, Syracuse Univ. Press
, p. xviii-xvix
In times of growth ...resources in limited supply.

IAC
Advantage Three: Market Collapse

MARKET FLUCTUATIONS ARE UNAVOIDABLE AND SPIRAL TOWARDS INEVITABLE IMPLOSION

ICSSA 2002
(Independent Center for Strategic Study and Analysis, "Witnessing the
End of Capitalism"_
ONLINE http://icssa.org/ICSS%20%20Themes_development_end_of_capitalism.htm
Accessed 8-9-04)

ENDING THE ELITES HOLD ON ENERGY PRODUCTION IS NECESSARY TO SOLVE

Kovel 2002
(Joel, Professor of Social Studies at Bard College, THE ENEMY OF
NATURE, page 157-158)

Observation 2
Fossil Fuels and Materials Cut Key to Social Learning and Sustainable Lifestyles
Milbrath 2003 Same Site As Above p48-9
"Learning our way to a new society… of life systems."

Changing social bases is key to a mindset shift
Trainer 1995 The Conserver Society: Alternatives for Sustainability p139-140
"It might seem that conserver… which we have to live."

Non-Governmental Fossil Fuel Consumption biggest culprit in our
current sustainability crisis
Pirages 2003 Same Source As Above p 64
"The internal combustion… foreign policy options."

Technical advances do not solve
Trainer 97

Important notes:

1.  The information on the left is the caselist information that I believe is accurate to date. I'd like
to get a full recent outline of all 1ACs that have been run by qualifying teams.  I'll post additional aff
info as it is available.  Please email 1AC outlines -- plan text, tags, cites to ssbauschard2@aol.com


2.  I'll post as much recent/accurate neg info that I recieve.

3. At tournament stuff will be linked from this home page and the pre-tournament stuff will be moved
off the main page.

NDT Scouting Information

During the tournament, scouting information will be added in individual affirmative and negative files for each round.  Open the file and find the information you are looking for.

 

 

FAQS

Can I download the file to my computer?

Yes, click on the link for the file you want and select “File-> Save As.” Save the file to where you want it and open it with a Word Process or Web Browser.

When will the training session be held?

Thursday after the reception.

 Why is the school information listed by round rather than by team?

 

Can I print the information?

 Sure, but you need your own printer.

 Are printed copies available anywhere?

 We will make a couple print copies available for people to share during the tournament near the scouting desk.
